page.title: 15WESTFIELD MINE : ENV. IMPACT
page.content: A person passing by Westfield Mining Complex cannot fail to notice the enormous impact which the mining activities have had on the local environment. The main features are the{spoil heaps of overburden which has been excavated from the pit. The heaps have been landscaped to form low hills but it is clear that they are{not natural.}Apart from the immediate area around the mine where overburden was dumped, the other main area is{Moss Plantation}to the north of Auchterderran which has been completely altered and is said to form the largest man made hill in Britain. Changes are going to take place in the landscape around the pit in the near future as the pit is going to be filled in and obviously some of the waste materials will be used for this.
